abstract.text: Retrieves a set of scores from Game Center.

inlineContent.text: Use the
method instead.

inlineContent.text: A block to call after retrieving the scores from the server.
The block receives the following parameters:
An array of
objects that holds the requested scores. If an error occurs, this value may be non-
. In this case, the array holds whatever score data GameKit retrieves from Game Center before the error occurs.
scores
If an error occurs, this error object describes the error. If the operation completes successfully, the value is
error

When you call this method, it creates a new background task to handle the request. The method then returns control to your game. When the task completes, GameKit calls your completion handler on the main thread.
The code below shows an example leaderboard data query. The method for this query initializes a new leaderboard object and configures the
, and
properties to retrieve the top ten scores for today.
You can create a leaderboard request that retrieves scores for a specific list of players.

You can call this method multiple times. Each call represents a different query against the scores stored in Game Center. If you post multiple load operations using the same leaderboard object, any properties that update by loading scores reflect the most recent query that completes. The order that achievement queries process is arbitrary.

abstract.text: Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
A leaderboard for a game that Game Center stores.
Loads the list of leaderboard categories along with their corresponding localized titles.
Returns the scores for the local player and other players for the specified type of player, time period, and ranks.
Loads a list of leaderboards from Game Center.
Retrieves a set of scores from Game Center.
A filter that restricts the search to a subset of the players in Game Center.
The numerical score rankings to return from the search.
Sets the default leaderboard for the local player.
A filter that restricts the search to scores within a specific period of time.
An object containing information for a score that was earned by the player.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
